sen.j: 高経死後に義将が幕政に復帰すると、管領の細川頼之と対立した。
sen.e: Upon Yoshimasa's return to the administration of Bakufu after the death of Takatsune, he conflicted with Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA, Kanrei.
Upon Yoshimasa's return to the administration of Bakufu after the death of Takatsune, he conflicted with Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA, who was Kanrei.

sen.e: Upon Yoshimasa's return to the administration of Bakufu after the death of Takatsune, he conflicted with Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA, who was Kanrei.

sen.j: 反細川派の勢力を結集し、3代将軍足利義満に頼之の罷免を求める康暦の政変で再び管領となる。
sen.e: Yoshimasa brought together anti-Hosokawa factions and gave rise to the Koryaku Coup in which they asked the third Shogun Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA to dismiss Yoriyuki, and then he became a Kanrei again.
Yoshimasa became a Kanrei again after the Koryaku Coup in which the anti-Hosokawa faction was gathered together and the third Shogun Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA was asked to dismiss Yoriyuki.

sen.e: Yoshimasa became a Kanrei again after the Koryaku Coup in which the anti-Hosokawa faction was gathered together and the third Shogun Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA was asked to dismiss Yoriyuki.

sen.j: 斯波義将は義満の没後も将軍足利義持を補佐し、朝廷から義満に対する太上天皇の尊号を追号する事を拒否したり、勘合貿易の廃止を提言するなど影響力を持った。
sen.e: Yoshimasa SHIBA acted as an adviser to Shogun Yoshimochi ASHIKAGA also after the death of Yoshimitsu and was so influential that he declined to accept the offer by the Imperial Court to give the posthumous title Emperor Daijo (Abdicated Emperor) to Yoshimitsu and suggested to abolish the tally trade (between Japan and the Ming dynasty).

Yoshimasa SHIBA assisted the Shogun Yoshimochi ASHIKAGA even after the death of Yoshimitsu, and he was so influential that he declined to accept the offer by the Imperial Court to give the posthumous title of Emperor Daijo (a Japanese Emperor who abdicated in favor of a successor) to Yoshimitsu and offered suggestions to abolish the tally trade (between Japan and the Ming dynasty).
sen.cmt: ①コンマを挿入し、文の区切りが分かりやすいようにしました。②「太上天皇」の説明をさらに補足しました。
sen.e: Yoshimasa SHIBA assisted the Shogun Yoshimochi ASHIKAGA even after the death of Yoshimitsu, and he was so influential that he declined to accept the offer by the Imperial Court to give the posthumous title of Emperor Daijo (a Japanese Emperor who abdicated in favor of a successor) to Yoshimitsu and offered suggestions to abolish the tally trade (between Japan and the Ming dynasty).

sen.j: 幕府において三管領四職七頭の制ができると、斯波氏は畠山氏、細川氏と管領を出す家柄として重んじられ、他の二家を抑えて三管領筆頭の家柄を有するに至った。
sen.e: After the system of Sankanrei (Three deputies), Shishiki (Four influential families) and Shichito (Seven influential families) in Bakufu, the Shiba clan was treated with respect as a Kanrei family together with the Hatakeyama clan and the Hosokawa clan and ended up becoming the head of the three Kanrei families overcoming the other two families.

After the establishment of Sankanrei, Shishiki (Four influential families) and Shichito (Seven influential families) in Bakufu, the Shiba clan was treated with respect as a Kanrei family together with the Hatakeyama clan and the Hosokawa clan and ended up becoming the head of the three Kanrei families by suppressing other two families.
sen.cmt: ①「三管領四職七頭の制ができると」に対応しthe establishment of としました。②「他の二家を抑えて」と手段を表現する訳に変更しました。
sen.e: After the establishment of Sankanrei, Shishiki (Four influential families) and Shichito (Seven influential families) in Bakufu, the Shiba clan was treated with respect as a Kanrei family together with the Hatakeyama clan and the Hosokawa clan and ended up becoming the head of the three Kanrei families by suppressing other two families.

sen.j: 斯波義重は1399年の応永の乱における大内氏討伐の功により越前国・尾張国の守護職を与えられ、以降世襲する。
sen.e: Yoshishige SHIBA was, in recognition of his putting down the Ouchi clan in the Oei Rebellion of 1399, appointed as Shugoshiki (military governor) of Echizen and Owari provinces and kept filling the posts by succession after that.

In recognition of his conquest of the Ouchi clan in the Oei Rebellion of 1399, Yoshishige SHIBA was appointed as Shugoshiki (military governor) of Echizen and Owari provinces which was kept in the order of succession after that.
sen.cmt: ①訳文の並びを変えました。②「大内氏討伐」を conquest of the Ouchi clanとしました。③「世襲する」のは守護職なので、訳をそのように変えました。
sen.e: In recognition of his conquest of the Ouchi clan in the Oei Rebellion of 1399, Yoshishige SHIBA was appointed as Shugoshiki (military governor) of Echizen and Owari provinces which was kept in the order of succession after that.

sen.j: しかし、義将死後は衰退への道をたどった。
sen.e: However, the Shiba clan fell into a decline after the death of Yoshimasa.
However, the Shiba clan began to fall into decline after the death of Yoshimasa.
sen.cmt: 「道をたどった」の意を訳に含めdeclineの前の冠詞を削除しました。
sen.e: However, the Shiba clan began to fall into decline after the death of Yoshimasa.

sen.j: 義将の甥である斯波満種は1414年に将軍足利義持の不興を買い、加賀守護職を失って高野山に隠退。
sen.e: Mitsutane SHIBA, a nephew of Yoshimasa, earned the displeasure of Shogun Yoshimochi ASHIKAGA in 1414 and lost his Shugoshiki of Kaga Province, then went into seclusion in Mt. Koya.
Mitsutane SHIBA, a nephew of Yoshimasa, incurred the displeasure of the Shogun Yoshimochi ASHIKAGA in 1414, lost his position as Shugoshiki of Kaga Province, and retired to Mt. Koya.
sen.cmt: ①「不興を買い」の動詞をincurに変更しました。②「高野山に隠退」の訳を変更しました。
sen.e: Mitsutane SHIBA, a nephew of Yoshimasa, incurred the displeasure of the Shogun Yoshimochi ASHIKAGA in 1414, lost his position as Shugoshiki of Kaga Province, and retired to Mt. Koya.

sen.j: 1409年に管領職を譲られた孫の斯波義淳もまもなく解任され、足利義教が6代将軍に就任するまで長い間、幕府から冷遇される事となった。
sen.e: While Yoshiatsu SHIBA, a grandchild, who had been given the Kanryo shoku (a post of Chief Adviser) was soon dismissed, the Shiba clan ended up being treated coldly by Bakufu for a long time until the inauguration of the sixth Shogun Yoshinori ASHIKAGA.

After Yoshiatsu SHIBA, a grandchild of Yoshimasa who had been given the Kanryo shoku (a post of Chief Adviser) in 1409, was soon dismissed, the Shiba clan had been treated coldly by Bakufu for a long time until the inauguration of the sixth Shogun Yoshinori ASHIKAGA.
sen.cmt: ①文の流れを自然にするためにafter節で文をはじめました。②「1409年」の訳を補足しました。
sen.e: After Yoshiatsu SHIBA, a grandchild of Yoshimasa who had been given the Kanryo shoku (a post of Chief Adviser) in 1409, was soon dismissed, the Shiba clan had been treated coldly by Bakufu for a long time until the inauguration of the sixth Shogun Yoshinori ASHIKAGA.

sen.e: The Shiba clan with such a high social standing as the head of the Sankanrei (Three deputies) was so powerfulthat both of the head family and the branch families of the Shiba clan based on Oshu (the Kosuiji Shiba clan, the Osaki clan, the Mogami clan, the Tendo clan and so on) were greatly prosperous at first.

The Shiba clan with such a high social standing as the head of the Sankanrei (Three deputies) was so powerfulthat both the head family and the branch families of the Shiba clan based in Oshu (the Kosuiji Shiba clan, the Osaki clan, the Mogami clan, the Tendo clan, and so on) were fairly prosperous at first.
sen.cmt: ①bothの後のofを削除しました。②「～に拠点を」based inに変更しました。③「大いに栄えた」be fairly prosperousに変更しました。
sen.e: The Shiba clan with such a high social standing as the head of the Sankanrei (Three deputies) was so powerfulthat both the head family and the branch families of the Shiba clan based in Oshu (the Kosuiji Shiba clan, the Osaki clan, the Mogami clan, the Tendo clan, and so on) were fairly prosperous at first.

sen.j: しかし、中央においては細川氏が政治の拠点 畿内を抑え、畠山氏も畿内近辺に所領を有した。
sen.e: However, in the capital, the Hosokawa clan held the political foothold, the Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto) and the Hatakeyama clan possessed the territories around the Kinai region.

For the central government, however, the Hosokawa clan secured the political foothold in the Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capital of Kyoto) and the Hatakeyama clan possessed the territories around the Kinai region.
sen.cmt: ①「中央においては」＝「中央政府においては」と解釈し訳を変更しました。②「を抑え」secured に変更しました。③「畿内」の説明文で~the ancient capital of Kyotoのみとしました。
sen.e: For the central government, however, the Hosokawa clan secured the political foothold in the Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capital of Kyoto) and the Hatakeyama clan possessed the territories around the Kinai region.

sen.j: これに対して、斯波氏の所領は尾張国と越前国という京都から遠い場所であり、また領地同士が分断されていた。
sen.e: On the other hand, the territories of the Shiba clan, Owari Province and Echizen Province, were away from Kyoto and separated each other.
On the other hand, the territories of the Shiba clan, Owari Province and Echizen Province, were away from Kyoto and separated each other.
On the other hand, the territories of the Shiba clan, Owari Province and Echizen Province, were away from Kyoto and separated each other.

sen.j: 当主は京に滞在していることが多いため、支配は守護代に委任せざるをえなかった。
sen.e: As the family head frequently stayed in Kyoto, he could not help entrusting Shugodai (Deputy military governor) with the ruling matters.
As the family head frequently stayed in Kyoto, he could not help but entrusting Shugodai (Deputy military governor) with the ruling matters.
sen.cmt: 「～せざるをえなかった」をcould not help but ~ingの形にしました。
sen.e: As the family head frequently stayed in Kyoto, he could not help but entrusting Shugodai (Deputy military governor) with the ruling matters.

sen.j: このため次第に領国の実権は朝倉氏や織田氏などの守護代、重臣らに牛耳られるようになっていった。
sen.e: Due to the above situation, the real power in its own territories was gradually taken away by the Shugodai and the chief retainers including the Asakura clan and the Oda clan.
Therefore, the real power in its own territories was gradually taken away by Shugodai and Jushin (chief retainer) including the Asakura clan and the Oda clan.
sen.cmt: ①「このため」をthereforeとしました。②「重臣」の読みと説明を加えました。
sen.e: Therefore, the real power in its own territories was gradually taken away by Shugodai and Jushin (chief retainer) including the Asakura clan and the Oda clan.

sen.j: 応仁の乱の際にいち早く斯波氏が守護職をつとめる越前で下克上が発生するのはそのためである。
sen.e: When the Onin War started, the above situation resulted in a Gekokujo (revolt of vassals against their lords) quickly brought about in Echizen Province where the Shiba clan served as Shugoshiki (military governor).
When the Onin War started, the above situation resulted in Gekokujo (revolt of vassals against their lords) which quickly began in Echizen Province where the Shiba clan was serving as Shugoshiki.
sen.cmt: ①「下克上」の冠詞を削除しました。②文後半の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: When the Onin War started, the above situation resulted in Gekokujo (revolt of vassals against their lords) which quickly began in Echizen Province where the Shiba clan was serving as Shugoshiki.

sen.j: 応仁の乱前夜、斯波家嫡流の武衛家では斯波義健没後、家督相続をめぐる争いが起こった。
sen.e: On the eve of the Onin War, a conflict occurred over the succession to the position of family head in the Buei family, the main branch of the Shiba family after the death of Yoshitake SHIBA.
On the eve of the Onin War, a conflict occurred over the succession to the position of family head in the Buei family, the main branch of the Shiba family, after the death of Yoshitake SHIBA.

sen.e: On the eve of the Onin War, a conflict occurred over the succession to the position of family head in the Buei family, the main branch of the Shiba family, after the death of Yoshitake SHIBA.

sen.j: 斯波氏庶家にあたる斯波大野氏からの養子縁組であった斯波義敏と、渋川氏出身の斯波義廉とが家督を巡って争ったのである。
sen.e: Yoshitoshi SHIBA who came in an adoption arrangement from the Shiba Ono clan, a branch family of the Shiba clan and Yoshikado SHIBA who came from the Shibukawa clan fought over reigns of the family.
Yoshitoshi SHIBA who was adopted by the Shiba Ono clan, a branch family of the Shiba clan, and Yoshikado SHIBA who came from the Shibukawa clan fought over the reign of the family.
sen.cmt: ①「養子縁組であった」をbe adopted byに変更しました。② a branch family of the Shiba clanの後にコンマを挿入しました。③ reignを単数にしました。
sen.e: Yoshitoshi SHIBA who was adopted by the Shiba Ono clan, a branch family of the Shiba clan, and Yoshikado SHIBA who came from the Shibukawa clan fought over the reign of the family.

sen.j: この家督争いが足利将軍家や畠山氏の家督相続と関係して1467年の応仁の乱を引き起こす原因の1つになる。
sen.e: That succession dispute partly caused the outbreak of the Onin War interrelating with the succession to the position of family head in the Ashikaga Shogunal family and that in the Hatakeyama clan.

That succession dispute partly caused the outbreak of the Onin War in 1467 in connection with the succession to the position of family head in the Ashikaga Shogunal family and that in the Hatakeyama clan.
sen.cmt: ① in 1467を補足しました。②「関係して」をin connection withに変更しました。
sen.e: That succession dispute partly caused the outbreak of the Onin War in 1467 in connection with the succession to the position of family head in the Ashikaga Shogunal family and that in the Hatakeyama clan.

sen.j: 応仁の乱に際しては義敏も義廉も領国に下ってその一円支配を目指すものの、遠江国を今川氏に、越前国を朝倉氏に奪われて領国の大半を失い、尾張国で義敏の子孫が守護代の織田氏に推戴されて存続するのみとなった。
sen.e: During the Onin War, Yoshitoshi and Yoshikado went down to their own territories to reign the whole region respectively, however, Totomi Province was taken by the Imagawa clan and Echizen Province by the Asakura clan, which meant the Shiba clan lost most of its own territories, and a descendant of Yoshitoshi only existed in Owari Province as the Shugo set up by the Oda clan, Shugodai.

During the Onin War, Yoshitoshi and Yoshikado went down to their own territories to reign the whole region; however, the Shiba clan lost most of its own territories after Totomi Province was captured by the Imagawa clan and Echizen Province by the Asakura clan, and only a descendant of Yoshitoshi remained in Owari Province as recommended by the Oda clan, which was Shugodai.
sen.cmt: ①訳文中のrespectivelyを削除しました。②however以降の文を自然に流れるように変更しました。③「織田氏に推戴されて」の内容を含む訳にしました。
sen.e: During the Onin War, Yoshitoshi and Yoshikado went down to their own territories to reign the whole region; however, the Shiba clan lost most of its own territories after Totomi Province was captured by the Imagawa clan and Echizen Province by the Asakura clan, and only a descendant of Yoshitoshi remained in Owari Province as recommended by the Oda clan, which was Shugodai.

sen.j: なお、斯波義廉の子斯波義俊は、室町将軍家の分家である越前の鞍谷公方を継ぎ、形式的な越前国主として朝倉氏に推戴された。
sen.e: Furthermore, Yoshitoshi SHIBA, a son of Yoshikado SHIBA succeeded Kuratani kubo of Echizen, a branch family of the Muromachi shogunate family and became the perfunctory head of Echizen Province set up by the Asakura clan.

Furthermore, Yoshitoshi SHIBA, a son of Yoshikado SHIBA, succeeded Kuratani kubo of Echizen, a branch family of the Muromachi shogunate family, and became a figurehead of Echizen Province as recommended by the Asakura clan.
sen.cmt: ①必要な箇所にコンマを挿入しました。②「形式的な～主」をfigureheadに変更しました。③「推戴された」の意味を含んだ訳にしました。
sen.e: Furthermore, Yoshitoshi SHIBA, a son of Yoshikado SHIBA, succeeded Kuratani kubo of Echizen, a branch family of the Muromachi shogunate family, and became a figurehead of Echizen Province as recommended by the Asakura clan.

sen.j: 尾張国のみを残すところとなった斯波氏であるが、応仁の乱後にすぐさま織田氏の傀儡となったわけではない。
sen.e: Although the Shiba clan ended up holding only Owari Province, it did not become a Kairai (puppet) of the Oda clan immediately after the Onin War.
Although the Shiba clan ended up holding only Owari Province, it did not become a Kairai (puppet) of the Oda clan immediately after the Onin War.
Although the Shiba clan ended up holding only Owari Province, it did not become a Kairai (puppet) of the Oda clan immediately after the Onin War.

sen.j: 斯波義寛が室町将軍による六角征伐へ織田氏を従えて参陣していることや、斯波義達が遠江国奪還のための出陣を繰り返すなど、依然、守護としての威令は保っていたようである。
sen.e: The Shiba clan seems to have maintained the authority of Shugo such as the facts that Yoshihiro SHIBA participated in the Rokkaku subjugation by the Muromachi Shogun with the Oda clan and that Yoshitatsu SHIBA repeated the departure for the frontto recapture Totomi Province.

The Shiba clan seems to have maintained the authority of Shugo judging from the fact that Yoshihiro SHIBA participated in Rokkaku subjugation by the Muromachi Shogun with the Oda clan and that Yoshitatsu SHIBA repeatedly went to war to recapture Totomi Province.
sen.cmt: ①「守護としての威令は保っていた」ことの判断となる文をjudging from the fact以下に記しました。②「出陣を繰り返す」を自然な流れに訳し直しました。
sen.e: The Shiba clan seems to have maintained the authority of Shugo judging from the fact that Yoshihiro SHIBA participated in Rokkaku subjugation by the Muromachi Shogun with the Oda clan and that Yoshitatsu SHIBA repeatedly went to war to recapture Totomi Province.

sen.j: しかし義達が今川氏親に敗れ遠江国奪還に失敗し、斯波義統が年少で当主となると、以後は織田氏の力が更に強まり、守護である斯波氏を完全に凌駕するようになる。
sen.e: When Yoshitatsu was defeated by Ujichika IMAGAWA failing in recovery of Totomi Province and Yoshimune SHIBA became the family head in early life, the Oda clan further increased its influence and completely surpassed the Shiba clan which was Shugo.

When Yoshitatsu was defeated by Ujichika IMAGAWA and failed to recapture Totomi Province and Yoshimune SHIBA became the family head in early life, the Oda clan extended its influence further and completely surpassed the Shiba clan, the Shugo.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: When Yoshitatsu was defeated by Ujichika IMAGAWA and failed to recapture Totomi Province and Yoshimune SHIBA became the family head in early life, the Oda clan extended its influence further and completely surpassed the Shiba clan, the Shugo.

sen.e: Furthermore, Nobunaga temporarily retired and returned his whole territory to the Shiba clan merely for form's sake to deceive several other clans and entered into an alliance with the Kira clan and the Imagawa clan respectively.

Furthermore, Nobunaga temporarily retired and returned his whole territories to the Shiba clan merely for form's sake to deceive several other clans, and entered into an alliance with the Kira clan and the Imagawa clan.
